titles.title: To authorize the placement in Arlington National Cemetery of a memorial honoring the World War II veterans who fought in the Battle of the Bulge.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Benefits.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. H. Rept. 107-589.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 353.

action.text: Mr. Moran (KS) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5055.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

bill.summary: 7/18/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Authorizes the Secretary of the Army to place in Arlington National Cemetery a memorial marker honoring veterans who fought in the Battle of the Bulge in the European theater of operations during World War II.
